content.key_points:
**Mongolian Spots:**

- Mongolian spots are irregular areas of deep blue pigmentation in the sacral and gluteal areas in the lower back of newborns of Asian, Africans, Hispanics, Southern Europeans, and Native Americans.

- The spots may fade as the child reaches 5 years of age.

questions.question_text: Mongolian spots are usually found in babies born from which of the following race?\n\nSelect all that apply.
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE**\n\nMongolian spots tend to occur in children of Asians, Southern Europeans, Hispanics, Africans, or Native Americans.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete Mongolian spot concept from right side of PDF page 163. All ethnic groups listed are correct answers. Spots are bluish discoloration in buttocks found in dark-skinned babies that fade by age 5.
extraction_metadata.reference: Pillitteri, Adele. Maternal and Child Health Nursing, Philadelphia. Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
